alert.note: Alert for Steuben (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 8:40AM EST until February 19 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Steuben County in central New York... * Until 930 AM EST. * At 840 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Conesus to 8 miles east of Belfast, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Hornell, Bath, Urbana, Canisteo, Wayland, Woodhull, Howard, Thurston, Wheeler and Avoca. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 34 North and 40. Interstate 390 between 1 and 3. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
